createData.title: Fix devenv vs staging steward conflict (ensure SSM params persist to AWS SSM, not localstack)
createData.description:
Fix the conflict where devenv stewards are writing SSM parameters to localstack instead of AWS SSM.

- Devenv stewards are conflicting with the staging steward
- Credentials are never saved to AWS SSM
- Mitigation: Johnny disabled devenv stewards temporarily
- Johnny will work on a fix to prevent the conflict and ensure SSM params persist to AWS SSM

linearState.title: Reduce alerts channel noise to near zero by end of week

Drive down noise in the alerts channel.

linearState.title: Decide controller loop approach for VibeWork demo (PR-based vs local agent container) and next steps
linearState.description:
Align on the controller loop approach and record next steps.

* JohnnyD to sync with Jordan and Brent this afternoon to align and decide the path
* Option A: Use GitHub PR as agent context and loop via Cursor; risk: multi-hour iteration due to dev env update latency (5–10 min per try) and flakiness
* Option B: Build local agent controller loop in a container with MCP tools (Tilt/dev env, browser, generate test plan), iterating until evidence is sufficient; potentially higher quality but larger upfront effort
* Decision criteria: iteration speed impact on progress; quality implications; demo viability (latency can be edited around in video if needed)
* Capture decision and create follow-up implementation tasks

linearState.title: Productionize PR review loop with internal Slack dump, then enable GitHub posting + reactions
linearState.description:
PR #2285: Grapevine Reviewer (multi-agent PR review system)
Link: [https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2285](https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2285)
Status: In review

Key changes delivered in PR #2285:

* New multi-agent PR Reviewer pipeline (initial analysis → category investigators → synthesis) with structured JSON output (path/lines, actionable comments, categories, impact/confidence)
* Corporate Context integration via MCP tools (keyword_search, semantic_search) to pull code/doc context
* Robust JSON parsing with json-repair fallback and validators
* Streaming MCP tool: /review_pr_streaming with status/phase/final events
* Evaluation framework and developer tooling: scripts/reviewer/pr_reviewer.py (CLI), scripts/call_pr_review_tool.py (HTTP caller), scripts/reviewer/compare_pr_reviews.py, fixtures/ground-truth examples
* Performance/scalability: token-aware batching and large-diff handling

Infra/guardrails:

* Feature gate for the reviewer tool (FeatureKeys.MCP_TOOL_PR_REVIEWER, enabled for LOCAL/STAGING)
* Tool executor excludes review_pr_streaming and ask\_\* tools to avoid recursion (HTTP-only usage)
* Usage tracking updated to include source review_pr_streaming
* Logging supports LOG_RENDERER override (console/json)
* Dependency added: json-repair

Notes:

* Active review with multiple comments on 2025-12-04; follow-ups may be required from review feedback.

linearState.title: Ability to eliminate orphaned tenant databases
linearState.description:
OpenSearch index audit utility to support orphaned tenant cleanup.

PR #2163: Open/In Review — [https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2163](https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2163)
Key changes:

* New script: scripts/opensearch_index_report.py
* Enumerates tenant OpenSearch indices (handles aliases and versioned indices) and extracts tenant IDs
* Reports doc_count, number_of_shards, number_of_replicas (resolves underlying index when given an alias)
* Batch fetches tenant metadata from the control DB via asyncpg; optionally resolves WorkOS org names
* Rate limiting via asyncio.Semaphore; configurable max concurrency and per-request delay
* Output formats: table, csv, json; includes totals in table view
* Uses admin credentials from environment to connect; performs a basic connectivity check and provides verbose error handling

Purpose: Provide an up-to-date audit of tenant indices to identify abandoned/unused or orphaned indices that can be pruned, aiding AIVP-954.

Author: btraut

linearState.title: Add description enhancement phase to ambient extraction
linearState.description:
PR #2258: Open (in review)
Link: [https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2258](https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2258)
Author: theonlyjohnny
Date: 2025-12-03

Key changes in PR #2258:

* Exponent Core: Adds utils/descriptionEnhancer.ts with enhanceTaskDescription and enhanceOperations to produce structured descriptions (Summary, Context, Requirements, optional Technical Considerations, References). Ensures no speculative details and falls back to original description; enhances CREATE ops in parallel. Exposes exports via index.ts.
* Grapevine MCP (ambient-extraction): Adds callAskAgentFast() in grapevine/client.ts to invoke ask_agent_fast with reasoning_effort=minimal, verbosity=low, disable_citations=true; uses a constrained MCPServerStdio connection and always closes it; parses JSON answer.
* Processors: Integrates enhancement into GitHub and Meeting processors by invoking enhanceOperations with ask_agent_fast; logs enhancement step.
* Slack Bot: Integrates enhancement in ambientProcessor via makeBackendRequest using toolName 'ask_agent_fast'; passes Slack message link for References and logs results.

Notes:

* Enhancement applies only to CREATE operations; UPDATE and SKIP unchanged.
* Evals remain unchanged to avoid performance impact.

linearState.title: Enable Intercom connector in Staging (track PR #2245)
linearState.description:
Enable Intercom in Staging and related connector updates.

PR #2245: Merged on 2025-12-03
Link: [https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2245](https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2245)

Key changes in PR #2245:

* Frontend/Admin:
  * Gate INTERCOM_ENABLED for local/staging; show Intercom integration (no "coming soon").
  * Remove "Conversations discovered" metric; display only indexed document count.
* Backend (Intercom):
  * Typed Pydantic models for Intercom API (IntercomConversationData, IntercomArticleData, IntercomContactData, IntercomCompanyData); artifacts/transformers updated to use typed models.
  * Shared timestamp utilities: normalize_timestamp and convert_timestamp_to_iso; replaced ad‑hoc parsing across extractors/transformers/documents.
  * Root backfill orchestration: IntercomApiBackfillRootConfig and IntercomBackfillRootExtractor to fan out companies/contacts/conversations/help_center; ingest worker registers intercom_api_backfill_root; child extractors no longer require SQS; CLI updated to send the root backfill config.
  * Help Center: use list API with client‑side updated_at filtering; author/parent parsing improvements; HTML-to-markdown conversion retained.
  * Chunking: use RecursiveCharacterTextSplitter across conversations, help center articles, contacts, and companies; add chunk_index/total_chunks to chunk metadata; fix duplicate chunk content in company/contact documents.
  * Cleanup: remove obsolete script scripts/intercom/test_intercom_conversations [bkp.py](http://bkp.py).

Related references mentioned in PR: CONN-447 (enable concurrent ingestion) and CONN-449 (implement chunk splitter).

linearState.title: Update Grapevine site legal links to point to www.gather.town/legal
linearState.description:
Update Grapevine properties to use the canonical Gather legal URLs.

PR #2240: Open (in review)
Link: [https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2240](https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2240)

Key changes:

* Added LegalFooter component pointing to [https://www.gather.town/legal](https://www.gather.town/legal) with anchors:
  * #privacy-policy
  * #terms-of-service
  * #data-processing-agreement
    Links open in a new tab and inherit text styling with hover underline.
* Integrated LegalFooter into Layout (admin pages) and FullscreenLayout (setup/onboarding) using variant="compact" for consistent presence across pages.
* Adjusted containers to direction="column" and flex={1} where appropriate so the footer stays at the bottom without overlapping content.
* Responsive behavior: footer wraps links at mobile widths (\~375px); no horizontal scrolling or clipped text.

Devenv deployment:

* Admin UI: [https://cc-devenv-2240.stg.getgrapevine.ai](https://cc-devenv-2240.stg.getgrapevine.ai)
* Admin Backend API: [https://cc-devenv-2240.stg.getgrapevine.ai/api](https://cc-devenv-2240.stg.getgrapevine.ai/api)
* MCP API: [https://mcp-cc-devenv-2240.stg.getgrapevine.ai](https://mcp-cc-devenv-2240.stg.getgrapevine.ai)

Test plan highlights:

1. Legal links present and correct on dashboard and other pages; open in a new tab and point to correct anchors under [https://www.gather.town/legal](https://www.gather.town/legal); footer does not overlap content.
2. Footer present on fullscreen setup/onboarding pages with FullscreenLayout; no layout regressions or scrolling issues.
3. Responsive layout at mobile width with proper wrapping and bullet separators.
4. Footer consistently appears on dashboard, integrations, settings, and usage pages.
